byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Mohamed Ali Kalfood from Sana, Yemen; and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, speaking during Middle East trip, warns of worsening humanitarian crisis in Yemen; announces plans to push Saudi Arabia to halt bombing campaign against Houthi rebels to facilitate delivery of critical aid; hostilities have reached fever pitch, with 80 people dying on same day of Kerry's remarks.
lead_paragraph: There was no evidence any cease-fire was imminent on Wednesday, as more than 80 people were killed across Yemen in some of the deadliest and most intense hostilities yet.

headline.main: Aid Needs in Yemen Are Dire, Kerry Says
headline.print_headline: Aid Needs in Yemen Are Dire, Kerry Says

snippet: There was no evidence any cease-fire was imminent on Wednesday, as more than 80 people were killed across Yemen in some of the deadliest and most intense hostilities yet.

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
